abstract: Heinz C. Schimmelbusch was abruptly ousted as the chief executive of Metallgesellschaft, the German metalworking conglomerate, in 1993. Now, after a decade in the U.S., he is back with a new company.
snippet: Heinz C. Schimmelbusch was abruptly ousted as the chief executive of Metallgesellschaft, the German metalworking conglomerate, in 1993. Now, after a decade in the U.S., he is back with a new company.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, Aug. 10 — Heinz C. Schimmelbusch still keeps an apartment here, insisting he feels at home in a city where he was once the toast of the local elite and then, seemingly overnight, the villain in one of the most notorious corporate scandals of the 1990s in Germany.

headline.main: German Chief Felled by Scandal Returns to Market on Smaller Scale
headline.print_headline: German Chief Felled by Scandal Returns to Market on Smaller Scale
